scenes.background: The team has successfully completed an important project, and everyone is excited to organize a celebration. However, there are differing opinions on how to celebrate. Colleague Sam suggests going to a bar for a lively party, Emma prefers a formal dinner, and Ryan proposes an outdoor team-building activity. Alex suggests a bit of everything: starting with an outdoor activity, then having dinner, and ending the night at a bar. Monica and Bob have been discussing this, and you notice some tension as they approach you. Monica crosses her arms and says, 'Alex, do you really think we can fit all that in one evening? And Bob here thinks we should just stick to one thing.' Bob nods in agreement, looking a bit annoyed. Alex insists that experiencing all three would be a memorable celebration and suggests giving it a try. Monica sighs and says, 'Alright, but what if we end up rushing through everything and no one enjoys any of it?' Bob adds, 'Yeah, and some of us might not even want to go to a bar.' Alex suggests giving it a go and adjusting as needed if they feel rushed. Monica frowns slightly and says, 'Adjusting as needed sounds risky. What if we can't make everyone happy?' Bob, scratching his head, mumbles, 'I still think a simple dinner would be less hassle.' Alex suggests having an open discussion with everyone to see what the majority prefers.
scenes.description: Monica leans back in her chair, looking thoughtful, while Bob crosses his arms and glances at you expectantly.

options.text: It's a tough call, but maybe we should go with the flow and see where the evening takes us.
options.analysis: This option shows a balanced approach but lacks strong direction, reflecting moderate emotional detection, self-regulation, empathy, social skills, and motivation.

options.text: You're probably right, Bob. A simple dinner might be the best way to keep things stress-free.
options.analysis: This choice shows good self-regulation and social skills but slightly lower empathy and motivation as it leans towards one suggestion over others.

options.text: I still think we should try to accommodate everyone's preferences. We can start with dinner and then decide if we want to continue with other activities.
options.analysis: This option shows a high level of emotional detection and empathy by considering everyone's preferences. It also demonstrates good social skills and motivation.
